about.title: Who is WaterMelon?
about.subtitle: We are WaterMelon, an international online store that has been helping people access their favorite services at affordable prices for over a year.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To make modern entertainment accessible to everyone, regardless of country or budget. We provide a convenient service that saves time, money, and nerves so you can get maximum enjoyment from what you love.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Personal Data Processing Policy
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how the online store ‚ÄúWaterMelon‚Äù (wtmelon.store) collects, stores, uses and protects users‚Äô personal data. We respect your privacy. By placing an order or contacting support, you provide certain information, and we use it solely to fulfill your order, provide technical support, and handle requests.

section1.title: 1. GENERAL PROVISIONS
section1.p1: This Policy is prepared in accordance with applicable Ukrainian legislation, including the Law of Ukraine ‚ÄúOn Personal Data Protection‚Äù.
section1.p2: By using the WaterMelon website, contacting us via official channels (messengers/social media) and/or paying for an order, the User (Customer) gives consent to the processing of personal data under this Policy to the extent necessary to provide services and fulfill the order.
section1.p3: The controller (owner) of personal data is Sole Proprietor (FOP) Sovha Yevheniia Vasylivna.

section2.title: 2. WHAT DATA WE COLLECT
section2.intro: We collect only the minimum information necessary to fulfill orders, communicate with you, and provide support:
section2.contact: Contact data: name (or nickname), messenger username/profile (e.g., Telegram), phone number, e-mail address.
section2.service: Service-related data: data required to provide access (e.g., account e-mail, invitation link, profile identifier). If, at your request, remote technical assistance is required, we may receive temporary access credentials (login/password or another access method) solely for activation/setup and only with your explicit consent.
section2.payment: Payment data: we do not collect or store full bank card details (card number, expiry date, CVV). Payments are processed by a bank/payment gateway (acquiring, including Fondy or another provider). We receive payment confirmation and basic payment attributes (amount, currency, status, transaction ID) only to the extent needed to fulfill the order and for accounting/tax purposes.
section2.technical: Technical data: IP address, browser and device type, event logs (may be collected automatically for security, fraud prevention and proper website operation).

section3.title: 3. PURPOSES OF DATA PROCESSING
section3.item1: Process and fulfill your order (provide access codes, invites, instructions, activation/setup).
section3.item2: Communicate with you via e-mail/messengers to clarify order details and provide technical support.
section3.item3: Resolve disputes and requests (access replacement, refunds, complaint handling).
section3.item4: Inform you about your order/subscription status (service messages related to your order).

section4.title: 4. ACCOUNT DATA SECURITY (IMPORTANT)
section4.p1: If, for activation/setup, you voluntarily provide us with access credentials to your account:
section4.item1: We use such credentials solely to fulfill your order and provide technical assistance.
section4.item2: We do not use your credentials for any other purposes and do not share them with third parties without lawful grounds.
section4.item3: We do not change critical account settings (email/login/password/payment settings) unless required to fulfill the order and agreed with you.
section4.p2: After the service is completed (activation/setup), we recommend changing your password (or another access method) if you provided it during order fulfillment.

section5.title: 5. SHARING DATA WITH THIRD PARTIES
section5.intro: We do not sell or share your personal data with third parties except where necessary to provide services or as required by law, including:
section5.item1: Banks, payment systems and payment providers/acquirers (e.g., Fondy or another provider) ‚Äî to process and confirm transactions, prevent fraud, and process refunds.
section5.item2: Communication services/messengers/e-mail providers (Telegram, Viber, Instagram, e-mail providers) ‚Äî to the extent necessary to communicate with you and provide support.
section5.item3: Upon a justified request by government authorities ‚Äî in accordance with Ukrainian law.
section5.note: We do not provide customer databases to spammers or advertising companies.

section6.title: 6. INFORMATION SECURITY AND RETENTION
section6.p1: Access to personal data is limited to authorized persons who need it to fulfill orders and provide support. We apply organizational and technical security measures to prevent unauthorized access.
section6.p2: The website uses SSL/TLS encryption to protect data transmission.
section6.p3: Retention period: we keep data no longer than necessary to fulfill orders, provide support, resolve disputes and/or comply with legal requirements (including payment accounting). Once it is no longer needed, data may be deleted or anonymized.

section7.title: 7. USER RIGHTS
section7.intro: Under Ukrainian law, you have the right to:
section7.item1: Know what personal data we process and for what purposes.
section7.item2: Request correction of inaccurate data or deletion of data if there are no lawful grounds for further retention.
section7.item3: Withdraw consent to data processing (this may make it impossible to fulfill an order or continue support if such data is technically/legally required).
section7.note: To exercise these rights, please contact our support using the details below.

section8.title: 8. CONTACT INFORMATION
section8.intro: If you have questions about privacy or want to exercise your rights, please contact us:
section8.telegram: Telegram: @WTmelon (or the current support contact listed on the website)
section8.address: Mailing address: Ukraine, 90000, Zakarpattia region, Khust district, urban-type settlement Mizhhiria, Nezalezhnosti street, building 19

terms.title: Public Offer Agreement (Terms of Service)
terms.subtitle: Digital Goods Supply and Digital Services
terms.intro: This document is a public offer (the ‚ÄúOffer‚Äù) of the online store ‚ÄúWaterMelon‚Äù (website: wtmelon.store) represented by Sole Proprietor (FOP) Sovha Yevheniia Vasylivna (the ‚ÄúProvider‚Äù), addressed to any legally capable individual and/or legal entity (the ‚ÄúCustomer‚Äù/‚ÄúConsumer‚Äù) to enter into an electronic agreement on the terms set out below.

section1.title: 1. TERMS AND DEFINITIONS
section1.offer: Offer ‚Äì the Provider‚Äôs public proposal to enter into an agreement on these terms, published on wtmelon.store and/or in WaterMelon‚Äôs official channels.
section1.acceptance: Acceptance ‚Äì the Customer‚Äôs full and unconditional acceptance of these terms by taking one or more actions: placing an order, making a payment, confirming consents (checkboxes), and/or actually receiving the Digital Goods/Services.
section1.digitalGoods: Digital Goods ‚Äì digital products (codes/keys/e-vouchers/subscriptions/activations/access) delivered electronically and enabling use of digital content or a service in accordance with the product description on the website.
section1.service: Digital Service / Service ‚Äì assistance with arranging, setting up, supporting, or providing technical help to obtain and use the Digital Goods/access.
section1.period: Access Period ‚Äì the duration for which access/activation is provided under the selected plan.
section1.durableMedium: Durable medium ‚Äì a means that allows information to be stored for future use (including e-mail, a user account on the website, or a file/message that can be saved).
section1.supportHours: Support hours ‚Äì daily from 10:00 to 22:00 (Kyiv time), unless stated otherwise on the website.

section2.title: 2. SUBJECT OF THE AGREEMENT
section2.p1: The Provider undertakes to supply the Customer with Digital Goods and/or provide Services, and the Customer undertakes to accept and pay for them.
section2.p2: Specific terms (name, plan, duration, scope, delivery method, price) are determined by the information on the website and/or the manager‚Äôs confirmation and form an integral part of this agreement.
section2.p3: Certain Digital Goods/Services may be related to third-party services. The Customer undertakes to comply with the rules of such services.
section2.p4: Official sales channels and contracts: The Provider operates based on contracts with suppliers/partners and/or through marketplaces. In particular, for certain digital goods/subscriptions the Provider acts under supply contracts with suppliers (e.g., SWEET.TV branded digital goods with the right to further sell to end consumers). The Provider may also sell goods/services through marketplaces, including the Rozetka platform (LLC ‚ÄúTerminal Rozetka‚Äù), in accordance with the rules and terms of such platforms.
section2.p5: Supporting documents: Upon a reasonable request from an acquiring bank/payment provider and/or competent authorities, the Provider may provide copies/extracts of documents confirming the legal basis of the business activity, while maintaining confidentiality and/or redacting sensitive data (if necessary).
section2.p6: Related documents: The Privacy Policy, Refund Policy, Delivery & Payment Policy, and the ‚ÄúLegal/Imprint‚Äù page published on the website are integral to WaterMelon‚Äôs service terms. In case of discrepancies, these Terms (the Offer) prevail.

section3.title: 3. LEGAL CAPACITY AND AGE
section3.p1: The Customer confirms they have full legal capacity to enter into this agreement.
section3.p2: If the Customer is under 18, the order and payment must be made with the consent of a legal guardian/representative.
section3.p3: The Customer also confirms compliance with any age restrictions that may apply under the rules of relevant services/content providers.

section4.title: 4. ORDERING AND DELIVERY
section4.p1: Orders may be placed on wtmelon.store or via a manager through WaterMelon‚Äôs official channels.
section4.p2: Delivery is electronic and may include: (a) providing a code/key/e-voucher; (b) providing a link/invitation (invite) or instructions; (c) providing technical support/assistance.
section4.p3: Remote technical assistance: Upon a separate request and the Customer‚Äôs explicit consent, the Provider may deliver remote technical assistance for setup/activation. In such cases, the Provider uses any provided data/access solely to fulfill the order, does not change critical account parameters (email/login/password/payment settings) unless agreed with the Customer, and may recommend changing the password after completion (if applicable).
section4.p4: Estimated delivery time: 15 minutes to 24 hours during support hours, unless stated otherwise on the website/order confirmation.
section4.p5: Moment of performance: Digital Goods/Services are deemed supplied/provided upon delivering the code/link/instructions or upon actual access being enabled (whichever occurs first).
section4.p51: Start of the Access Period: If, for a specific Digital Good/subscription, the Access Period depends on actual activation on the service side, the Access Period starts from the moment of actual activation/access enablement, confirmed by the service‚Äôs technical status and/or the Provider‚Äôs electronic notification.
section4.p6: Order/payment confirmations (receipt/email/message) are provided to the Customer electronically (durable medium).

section5.title: 5. PRICE, CURRENCY AND PAYMENT
section5.p1: Prices are shown on the website or communicated by the manager before payment.
section5.p2: Payments may be made in UAH / USD / EUR (depending on the payment page). Any currency conversion is performed by the Customer‚Äôs bank/payment system.
section5.p3: Payment methods: bank card via acquiring/payment provider, bank transfer to the Provider‚Äôs IBAN, or other methods available on the website.
section5.p4: Payment is deemed completed when the payment transaction is confirmed by the payment system or funds are credited to the Provider‚Äôs account.
section5.p5: The Customer agrees that order/payment confirmations and messages regarding delivery/replacement/refunds may be sent electronically (e-mail, messenger message, personal account), which constitutes a durable medium.

section6.title: 6. START OF PERFORMANCE BEFORE THE END OF THE 14-DAY PERIOD AND RIGHT OF WITHDRAWAL
section6.p1: Certain Digital Goods/Services may constitute digital content/digital services supplied not on a tangible medium.
section6.p2: The Customer confirms that before making payment they had the opportunity to review these Terms and the related policies published on the website.
section6.p3: Fast-start option (Customer‚Äôs choice): The Customer may voluntarily request that order fulfillment and/or digital content supply starts before the end of a 14-day withdrawal period (if such period applies to a particular order). In such case, the Customer provides consent by ticking a separate checkbox during checkout and/or by written confirmation in electronic form (e-mail/messenger).
section6.p4: The Customer acknowledges that where digital content/digital services are supplied not on a tangible medium and supply has actually started with the Customer‚Äôs prior explicit consent, the right to withdraw after supply starts may be limited to the extent permitted by applicable law.
section6.p5: If the Customer did not provide the consent described in clause 6.3, the Provider will start fulfillment in the timeframe and manner agreed with the Customer in correspondence and/or in the order confirmation.

section7.title: 7. WARRANTIES, CONFORMITY AND SUPPORT
section7.p1: The Provider warrants that at the time of delivery the Digital Goods/access correspond to the order description.
section7.p2: If Digital Goods/Services are not provided, the Customer may request provision; if the Provider fails to provide within an additionally agreed or reasonable time, the Customer may cancel the agreement.
section7.p3: In case of non-conformity (access/activation does not work or does not work as described), the Customer may request conformity (restoration/replacement) or a proportional price reduction/cancellation, as provided by law.
section7.p4: Standard support response time is up to 24 hours during support hours.

section8.title: 8. REPLACEMENT AND REFUNDS
section8.p1: If access/activation stops before the end of the Access Period not due to the Customer (including technical issues on the service side), upon the Customer‚Äôs request the Provider will within 24 hours: (a) restore access; or (b) provide a replacement (equivalent access/activation to the same service).
section8.p2: By mutual agreement, an alternative may be provided: another digital good/service on equivalent terms.
section8.p3: If the Provider failed to provide/connect access due to the Provider‚Äôs fault, or failed to restore/replace access within the timeframe stated in clause 8.1, the Customer may request: (a) a refund; or (b) a refund for the unused part of the Access Period (pro-rata).
section8.p4: Refunds are made using the same payment method used for payment, or another agreed method if technically necessary.
section8.p41: Support channels: Requests regarding order fulfillment, access restoration/replacement and/or refunds are accepted via any contact channel listed in the ‚ÄúLegal/Contacts‚Äù section on the website.
section8.p5: Pro-rata refund calculation: If a pro-rata refund applies, the amount is calculated based on unused days/period of the paid plan (e.g., paid amount / number of days in the Access Period √ó unused days), unless a different method is specified by the plan‚Äôs terms.
section8.p6: Refund timing: Refunds are processed within the timeframe required by law and payment system rules, but typically no later than 14 calendar days from the date the parties agree on the grounds for the refund (unless otherwise required by law or the bank/provider‚Äôs technical procedure).

section9.title: 9. USE RULES AND LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
section9.p1: The Customer must not take actions that may cause loss of access (violation of service rules, fraud, circumvention of restrictions, etc.).
section9.p2: If the Customer violates a third-party service‚Äôs rules resulting in blocking/restriction, the Provider‚Äôs warranty obligations may not apply.
section9.liability: The Provider is not liable for:
section9.liabilityItem1: global technical outages of third-party services;
section9.liabilityItem3: consequences of the Customer‚Äôs actions contrary to the Provider‚Äôs instructions or service rules;
section9.liabilityItem4: inability to use a service if the Customer lacks technical capability or the right to use it (including due to the service‚Äôs requirements/restrictions, regional limitations, age, account/device settings, etc.), provided the Provider supplied access/activation according to the order description.

section10.title: 10. PERSONAL DATA
section10.p1: Personal data is processed by the Provider in accordance with the website‚Äôs Privacy Policy and applicable Ukrainian law.
section10.p2: If the Customer provides access data for remote technical assistance, the Provider uses it solely to fulfill the order and does not share it with third parties without lawful grounds.

section11.title: 11. FORCE MAJEURE
section11.p1: The parties are released from liability for non-performance caused by force majeure events (war, blackouts, cyberattacks, accidents, communication outages, etc.).

section12.title: 12. TERM, CHANGES, LANGUAGE
section12.p1: This agreement enters into force upon Acceptance and remains effective until the parties fulfill their obligations.
section12.p2: The Provider may amend these Terms. A new version becomes effective upon publication on the website and applies to orders placed after publication.
section12.p3: These Terms may be available in multiple languages. In case of discrepancies, the Ukrainian version prevails.

section13.title: 13. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTES
section13.p1: Governing law: the law of Ukraine.
section13.p2: Disputes are resolved through negotiations, and if no agreement is reached, in accordance with Ukrainian law.
section13.p3: If the Customer is a consumer permanently residing outside Ukraine, mandatory consumer protection rules of the country of residence may apply to the extent expressly provided by private international law and/or applicable legislation.

section14.title: 14. PROVIDER DETAILS
section14.address: Address: Ukraine, 90000, Zakarpattia region, Khust district, urban-type settlement Mizhhiria, Nezalezhnosti street, building 19

section1.title: 1. GENERAL TERMS
section1.p1: We strive to provide the highest quality of service and guarantee the functionality of all provided services for the paid period.
section1.p2: In case of problems with service access, we undertake to resolve them as quickly as possible or refund your money according to the terms outlined below.

section2.title: 2. REFUND CONDITIONS
section2.intro: Refunds are possible in the following cases:
section2.item1: The service proved to be non-functional due to technical reasons, and we were unable to provide a replacement or restore functionality within 24 hours.
section2.item2: We failed to fulfill the obligation to activate the subscription within the specified timeframe.
section2.item3: Access was provided before payment (post-payment), but it doesn't work and we couldn't fix the situation.

section3.title: 3. CASES WHEN REFUNDS ARE NOT ISSUED
section3.p1: Refunds are not issued in the following cases:
section3.item1: The customer changed their mind after receiving working access to the service (digital goods are considered consumed at the moment of provision).
section3.item2: Problems arose due to violation of usage rules by the customer (unauthorized changes to account data, violation of service rules, etc.).

section4.title: 4. REFUND PROCEDURE
section4.p1: To request a refund, contact our support via Telegram or email within 7 days from the payment date.
section4.p2: Refunds are made to the same account from which payment was made, within 5-10 business days after request approval.

section5.title: 5. CONTACT INFORMATION
section5.contact: For refund or exchange requests, contact us:

section1.title: 1. SERVICE DELIVERY METHODS
section1.p1: Since we provide digital services (subscription access), physical delivery is not required. Access is provided online in one of the following ways:
section1.p2: Access delivery depends on the type of subscription chosen and the specific service features.

section2.title: 2. ORDER AND DELIVERY PROCESS
section2.intro: The process of receiving subscription access:
section2.step1: Choose the desired subscription on our website or contact our manager via Telegram.
section2.step2: Place your order and make payment.
section2.step3: Receive order confirmation from our manager.
section2.step4: Receive access within 15 minutes - 24 hours after payment.

section3.title: 3. SERVICE DELIVERY TIME
section3.p1: Standard subscription activation time: from 15 minutes to 24 hours during business hours.
section3.p2: In exceptional cases (technical failures, high load), the time may be extended to 48 hours. We will definitely notify you about this.

section4.title: 4. PAYMENT METHODS
section4.p1: We accept payment by the following methods:
section4.item1: Bank transfer to Sole Proprietorship account (details provided when placing order).

section5.title: 5. CONTACT INFORMATION
section5.contact: For questions about payment and service delivery, contact us:
